title: A Lightweight Data Mining Approach for Fake Review Detection: An Integrated Textual and Behavioral Analysis
subtitle: 3rd International Conference on Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning (BIM 2025)
description: This research presents a lightweight data mining methodology designed to detect fraudulent reviews by integrating both textual content analysis and user behavioral patterns[cite: 1, 8, 9]. Presented at the 3rd International Conference on Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
story: This project addressed the growing challenge of trust in digital marketplaces. By combining how a review is written with how a user behaves, we created a more robust detection system that doesn't require massive computational resources.
venue: 3rd International Conference on Big Data, IoT and Machine Learning (BIM 2025)

title: Automated Skin Diseases Detection: Multi-Class Lesion Classification via Balanced Transfer Learning and Deep Ensemble Learning
subtitle: American International University-Bangladesh (AIUB) Research
description: A comprehensive framework that integrates balanced transfer learning with robust deep ensemble architectures to optimize multi-class classification performance for five distinct skin conditions, including rare ones like SJS-TEN and Vitiligo.
story: Motivated by diagnostic delays and specialist shortages, this research curated a novel repository of 9,548 self-collected images to establish a high-precision, cost-effective automated classifier for resource-limited settings.
